event.summary: 03/16/1993: The Turkish Communist Toilers Party bombed the office of the Social Democratic Populist Party. No injuries or casualties resulted from the incident.
event.motive: Members of the Turkish Communist Toilers Party claimed that the Social Democrats, junior partners in the governing coalition, had bowed to the will of conservative premier Suleyman Demirel.
event.propcomment: Three bombs exploded causing moderate damage to the office building.
event.addnotes: The attack on the political party came after a night of over a dozen bombings on banks and businesses throughout Turkey. The attacks followed a recent police crack down on Dev Sol. No one claimed responsibility for the attacks. There were no injuries or casualties from the attack on the political party office.
event.scite1: “Bomb Attacks Continue in Turkey,” The Associated Press, March 16, 1993.
